title: Practice Challenge
description: 1. Open your terminal (PowerShell on Windows, Terminal on Mac/Linux) 2. Run this command:    ```bash    flutter --version    ``` 3. You should see something like:    ```    Flutter 3.38.x • channel stable    Tools • Dart 3.10.x    ``` 4. Now run:    ```bash    flutter doctor    ``` 5. You'll probably see:    - ✅ Green checkmarks (Flutter, Dart)    - ❌ Red X marks (Android Studio, Chrome, Xcode) ---
instructions: 1. Open your terminal (PowerShell on Windows, Terminal on Mac/Linux) 2. Run this command:    ```bash    flutter --version    ``` 3. You should see something like:    ```    Flutter 3.38.x • channel stable    Tools • Dart 3.10.x    ``` 4. Now run:    ```bash    flutter doctor    ``` 5. You'll probably see:    - ✅ Green checkmarks (Flutter, Dart)    - ❌ Red X marks (Android Studio, Chrome, Xcode) ---

hints.text: Open your terminal (PowerShell on Windows, Terminal on Mac/Linux) and type the commands exactly as shown.
If 'flutter' is not recognized, your PATH is not set correctly. Review the installation steps.

commonMistakes.consequence: Terminal shows 'flutter is not recognized' or 'command not found'
commonMistakes.correction: Add Flutter to your PATH and restart terminal

commonMistakes.consequence: Issues with permissions or spaces in path
commonMistakes.correction: Install to a simple path like C:\src\flutter

commonMistakes.mistake: Not restarting terminal after PATH changes
commonMistakes.correction: Close and reopen your terminal window
